marketNews.title: Prospective Ministers Summoned, Sri Mulyani Asked Again to be Finance Minister
marketNews.content: President-elect, Prabowo Subianto, on Monday (14/10) evening summoned a number of prospective ministers and deputy ministers for the upcoming cabinet. Here are some of our important notes: Number of ministries increases - Prabowo summoned 49 people last night and confirmed that there will still be summons for the remaining prospective ministers and deputy ministers on Tuesday (15/10). Although it is not yet known which ones will become ministers and deputy ministers along with their respective ministries, the number of summons appears to be in line with reports that the number of ministries will increase in the next government. Some time ago, it was reported that the next government would have 46 ministries, an increase from the current 34 ministries. Ministers related to the economy - 10 out of 17 ministers whom we assess are directly related to the economy in the current government were also summoned last night. This is in line with reports some time ago that Prabowo would retain many ministers from the current cabinet. Responding to last night's summons, Sri Mulyani stated that she was re-asked to become the Minister of Finance. Sri Mulyani also signaled that she is open to continuing in that position. Plan for the separation of the State Revenue Agency (BPN) - On the same occasion, Sri Mulyani dismissed the issue of establishing the BPN. Previously, Prabowo was reported to plan to separate the Directorate General of Taxes (DJP) and the Directorate General of Customs and Excise (DJBC) from the Ministry of Finance in his efforts to increase state revenue levels.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although further clarification or information is still needed, we assess the political developments above as tending to be positive for the market. If the current economic ministers return to serve in related economic ministries in the next government, this will provide certainty and relief for the market that economic stability can be maintained. However, the risk comes from the significant addition in the number of ministries which has the potential to cause inefficiency. In today's trading, Tuesday (15/10), the IHSG strengthened +0.89% to the level of 7,627 with a net foreign inflow of 289.5 billion rupiah. Meanwhile, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar weakened slightly by -0.13% to the level of 15,575, although it still outperformed the movements of the exchange rates of several neighboring countries against the US Dollar, such as Malaysia (-0.30%), Thailand (-0.05%), and the Philippines (-0.65%).

tickerNews.title: ENRG Acquires Participation Rights of Sengkang Gas Block
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada through its subsidiary, PT EMP Energi Jaya, announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire a 51% participation right in the production sharing contract (PSC) in the Sengkang Block, South Sulawesi. The total transaction value was not announced, while the transaction is expected to be completed by October 31, 2024. Currently, ENRG's other subsidiary, PT Energi Maju Abadi, already holds a 49% participation right in the Sengkang Block. The Sengkang PSC currently has a production capacity of approximately 50 million cubic feet of gas per day, with PLN acting as the main buyer. The gas block has proven and probable gas reserves of approximately 380 billion cubic feet of gas.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Records Significant Net Profit Increase in 3Q24
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya recorded a net profit of 55.5 billion rupiah in 3Q24, a significant increase compared to the net profit of 11.1 billion rupiah in 3Q23 and 3.6 billion rupiah in 2Q24. This result brought the net profit for 9M24 to reach 69.3 billion rupiah, compared to 23.5 billion rupiah in 9M23. The surge in net profit in 3Q24 was primarily caused by a much smaller proportion of minority interest. Operationally, operating profit in 3Q24 decreased by -57.9% YoY to 116.8 billion rupiah, although it still grew by +43.6% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: No Fatalities in Freeport Smelter Fire at AKRA's JIIPE Area
tickerNews.content: VP Corporate Communications of PT Freeport Indonesia, Katri Krisnati, stated that there were no fatalities in the company's copper smelter fire in the JIIPE industrial complex owned by AKR Corporindo in Gresik, East Java. The fire at the facility occurred at 17:45 WIB on Monday (14/10). The fire has now been extinguished, and Katri stated that they will conduct an evaluation regarding the main cause of the incident.

tickerNews.title: IBST Obtains IDR 600 Billion Loan Facility from Bank Permata (BNLI)
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara's subsidiary, Inti Bangun Sejahtera ($IBST), obtained a loan facility of 600 billion rupiah from Bank Permata ($BNLI). The funds obtained are intended to finance capital expenditure and refinancing of previous loans. The loan will mature on October 10, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Mark Dynamics Indonesia Shareholder Sells Stake
tickerNews.content: Mark Dynamics Indonesia shareholder, PT Dyna Capital Indo, sold approximately 20.3 million MARK shares at an average price of 1,100 rupiah per share on October 14, 2024. The total transaction value reached 22.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Dyna Capital Indo in MARK decreased from 21.23% to 20.7%.

tickerNews.title: Dharma Polimetal Commissioner Purchases DRMA Shares
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal Commissioner, Noel Aelyo Laras Kusuma Negara, purchased 1.2 million DRMA shares at an average price of 1,100 rupiah per share on October 11, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Noel's ownership in DRMA increased from 1.36% to 1.39%.

tickerNews.title: BBKP Plans to Issue Up to USD 300 Million Senior Unsecured Notes
tickerNews.content: Bank KB Bukopin plans to issue senior unsecured notes amounting to up to 300 million US dollars or 4.65 trillion rupiah. The roadshow to potential investors is planned to be held on October 16-18, 2024, with pricing scheduled for October 21, 2024. The plan for the use of funds will be announced after the roadshow period. The bonds will be listed on the Singapore Stock Exchange (SGX-ST).

tickerNews.title: PYFA and RGCC Sign MoU for Personalized Cancer Treatment in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Pyridam Farma and Research Genetic Cancer Center (RGCC), a Swiss cancer research institution, signed a memorandum of understanding for cooperation on Tuesday (15/10) to introduce cancer treatment in Indonesia. RGCC itself is a cancer research institution that develops diagnostic tests and personalized cancer drug development. Through this collaboration, PYFA will become RGCC's partner in marketing and distributing RGCC products in the Indonesian market. Meanwhile, RGCC will become PYFA's partner to enter the European market to meet quality standards according to the region's standards.

tickerNews.title: RAJA Subsidiary Secures Contract for Booster Compression Plant Rental in Sengkang Block
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja, through its subsidiary, PT Triguna Internusa Pratama, obtained a service contract for the rental of a booster compression plant with Energy Equity Epic (Sengkang) Pty. Ltd. The total transaction value was not announced. This cooperation aims at the development of Kampung Baru in the Sengkang Block.

tickerNews.title: Investment Realization Reached IDR 1,200 Trillion Until September, Foreign Investment Dominates
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Investment recorded that investment realization in Indonesia during 9M24 reached 1,261 trillion rupiah (+19.8% YoY), equivalent to 76.4% of the 2024 target of 1,650 trillion rupiah. Foreign direct investment (FDI) was recorded at 654 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY), while domestic investment grew to 607 trillion rupiah (+23% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Chinese Media Reports China May Issue USD 846 Billion in Special Bonds
tickerNews.content: Chinese media, Caixin, reported that the Chinese government might raise funds amounting to 6 trillion yuan or 846 billion US dollars through the issuance of long-term special bonds over 3 years. The funds are reported to be used to help local governments relieve their debt burden to boost the sluggish economy. This news comes amid speculation by investors and analysts regarding the amount of debt that the Chinese government will issue to fund its latest fiscal stimulus package. Last week, the Chinese Finance Minister, Lan Fo'an, stated that there is room for the central government to increase debt, although he did not specify the amount.

tickerNews.title: Economists Survey Expects Bank Indonesia to Hold Key Rate at 6% in October
tickerNews.content: The consensus of economists surveyed by Reuters expects Bank Indonesia to maintain the BI Rate at 6% in the Board of Governors Meeting on October 16, 2024. This expectation has changed compared to last month's survey after Bank Indonesia unexpectedly cut the BI Rate by -25 bps, where the consensus of economists predicted Bank Indonesia would cut interest rates again in October 2024. This change in expectation is driven by the receding expectation of aggressive monetary easing from the Fed following solid labor data, which caused the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar to fall -3% from its recent peak in September 2024.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia's Trade Balance Surplus Reached USD 3.26 Billion in September 2024
tickerNews.content: BPS recorded that Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 3.26 billion US dollars in September 2024 (vs. August 2024: surplus 2.78 billion US dollars, September 2023: surplus 3.40 billion US dollars), exceeding the consensus expectation which forecasted a surplus of 2.83 billion US dollars. Exports grew by +6.44% YoY and imports grew by +8.55% YoY in September 2024, respectively lower than the consensus expectations of +8% YoY and +11.8% YoY. During 9M24, Indonesia's trade balance surplus reached 27.72 billion US dollars (vs. 9M23: surplus 27.75 billion US dollars), with exports and imports rising by +0.32% YoY and +3.86% YoY, respectively.

tickerNews.title: Indian Government Announces USD 109 Billion Transmission Plan for Green Energy
tickerNews.content: The Indian government announced a plan to overhaul its electricity grid to integrate 600 GW of renewable energy by 2032. The project, worth 9.15 trillion rupees or 109 billion US dollars, is targeted to integrate 500 GW of renewable energy by 2030, reflecting more than a 2x increase compared to the current level. Post-2030, India targets an additional installation of 100 GW of renewable energy into its electricity grid until 2032.

tickerNews.title: Warner Bros Discovery to Launch Max Streaming Service in Seven Asian Markets in November
tickerNews.content: Warner Bros Discovery (Nasdaq: WBD) announced it will launch its streaming service, Max, in 7 Asian countries on November 19, 2024, making the platform available in more than 72 countries. Warner Bros stated it will bring popular content from iconic brands such as HBO, Discovery, DC Universe, Harry Potter, and Cartoon Network to Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. This announcement comes after Warner Bros stated in September 2024 that they were targeting more than 6 million new subscribers for the Max streaming platform in 3Q24.

tickerNews.title: Transcoal Pacific (TCPI) Subsidiary Sells Barge for Fleet Renewal
tickerNews.content: Transcoal Pacific ($TCPI) through its subsidiary, PT Energy Transporter Indonesia, announced the sale of 1 unit of a barge for 6 billion rupiah. The sale is intended for the rejuvenation of the fleet owned by PT Energy Transporter Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: ITSEC Asia (CYBR) Director Sells Shares
tickerNews.content: ITSEC Asia ($CYBR) Director, Bambang Susilo, sold 1.5 million CYBR shares at an average price of 311 rupiah per share on October 11-14, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 478 million rupiah. After this transaction, Bambang's ownership in CYBR decreased from 0.486% to 0.463%.
